title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.27 | 22-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: In this session we will be discussing from the 27th verse of the 6th chapter of the 1st
canto Srimad Bhagavatam.
The meaning of this verse is, And so, O Bramhna Vyasadeva, in due course of time, I, who was
fully absorbed in thinking of Krishna and who therefore had no attachment to Krishna,
am being completely free from all material taints, met with death, as lightning and illumination
occurs simultaneously.
So Narada Muni is going to conclude his description about his previous life.
This is the last verse about his previous life.
What happened?
As he was engaged in traveling throughout the earth, chanting and glorifying the Lord
without any material formalities.
He, in course of time, when he had become fully absorbed in thinking of Krishna and
in such a state of consciousness, he did not think of Krishna.
So he was not fully absorbed in thinking of Krishna.
he had become completely free from all material attachments no attachment to
anything in this material world it is important to note this that even if a
devotee has a tinge of material attachment he has to take birth again
after quitting this body in the material world whereas that devotee who is
completely free from all attachments and how is that possible becoming fully
absorbed in thinking of Krishna by constantly engaging in chanting and
hearing and glorifying the name fame pastimes activities qualities of the
Supreme Lord
being completely freed from all material taints completely free from all
material taints as one goes on chanting and hearing the heart becomes cleansed
and no further contamination can enter because such a devotee is always engaged
thinking of Krishna, always engaged in hearing about Krishna, always engaged in
chanting the holy name, fame, qualities, past times of Krishna etc. So no further
contamination and all past contamination is completely cleansed away. Then in
course of time he met with death. What is that death? Quitting the present body
Krishna says in the Bhagavad Gita, the soul doesn't die, the real
person, the spiritual identity is not lost at the time of death. It is only the
material body that one quits. So met with death as lightning in the
lightening and illumination occurs simultaneously. Now what is the
significance of Narada Muni telling he met with death as lightning and
illumination occurs simultaneously is explained by Prabhupada in the purport.
So let us go through the purport. To be fully absorbed in the thought of Krishna
means clearance of material dirts or hankerings.
Such cleansing away of material dirt is not possible for somebody who is
engaged in material activities. Material activity means actions and reactions
under the influence of the three gunas. So material activity means what is the
material activity means one becomes further entangled more and more in the
material existence. Whereas cleansing away the material dirt by being absorbed
fully in thought of Krishna means no more material entanglement, no more material
contamination. And Srila Prabhupada gives a nice example here. As a very rich
man has no hankerings for small petty things. So also a devotee of Lord Krishna
who is guaranteed to pass on to the kingdom of God where life is eternal,
fully cognizant and blissful. Satchitananda. Naturally has no hankerings for petty
material things which are like dolls or shadows of the reality and are without
permanent value. Srila Prabhupada is nicely summarizing. What is this material
existence consisting of? Petty material things and these material things have no
permanent value. Nothing material has permanent value. We discussed this in a
previous session.
So this being reinforced this understanding for our benefit because we have got a
background of having developed value for so many different material objects or
material things. But now in spiritual life we should understand none of those
material things are of any permanent value. They are compared to material
things. Compared to shadows of reality. That means the real shadow means there is
a real object of which the shadow is nothing but a reflection. So the real object
is valuable. The shadow is not. Similarly anything material is nothing but a
shadow or a reflection of the spiritual reality. So if we have a material body it
is a reflection or a shadow of our spiritual form, spiritual body. That
spiritual body is covered by material coverings.
Similarly the entire material world itself not only our own form but even the
material world itself is nothing but a reflection or a shadow of the spiritual
world. Krishna's personal abode. Parastasmatubhavonyo vyakto vyaktatsanatanah.
That eternal abode of the Supreme Lord.
It is called the kingdom of God where life is eternal, fully cognizant and blissful.
There are no miseries. There is no ignorance. There is no temporary life.
There is only eternal life. There is full cognizance, full knowledge. Full knowledge.
There is no ignorance at all. And there is no misery. There is no suffering. There is
no disease, old age. There is no death. Completely blissful. That place, the kingdom
of God is of permanent value, is eternal. So that is where we belong. That should be
our destination. So Srila Prabhupada says that is the sign of spiritually enriched
persons. Spiritually enriched persons. That's how they lose all attraction for
everything material. That's how they lose value for anything material. And in due
course of time when a pure devotee is completely prepared. What is the complete
preparation? Full absorption in thought of Krishna. Complete preparation of the
self. Completely purified of all material taints and completely freed from all material
hankerings. No more material contamination. No more material attachments. Completely freed.
Then all of a sudden the change of body occurs which is commonly called the change of the
body occurs which is commonly called death. For a devotee, death is a sudden change of
body. What is this change of body? This change of body for a devotee is that it takes place
exactly like lightning and illumination follow simultaneously. In this, when there are rains,
you can see there is a flash of lightning. It is simultaneously occurring with the sound
of the thunder. So like that a devotee simultaneously changes his material body and develops a spiritual
body by the will of the Supreme.
Both happen simultaneously. The material body, generally when we quit this material
body, we enter another material body. For those who are not fully purified by devotional
service, they will enter another material body. But those who are completely purified
and are fully ready to go to the kingdom of God, to go back to Godhead, for them simultaneously
the material body, the devotee quits the material body and simultaneously develops a fully spiritual
body by the will of the Supreme. This happens by the will of the Lord.
Actually, it is described here, even before death for a pure devotee, there is no material
affection. Why? Because a pure devotee's body being completely engaged in pure devotional
service becomes spiritualized. A pure devotee's body, material body, so called material body,
is not material at all. It is spiritualized because he completely engages his body, his
mind, his words, everything in Krishna's pure devotional service. Exactly like an iron rod
when placed in fire becomes completely red hot and acts like fire.
This is the best example. Easily we can understand. Iron rod placed in blazing fire becomes completely
red hot, then it acts like fire. Similarly, a pure devotee's material body, which we see
ordinarily with our eyes as a material body, actually is not anymore material because he
is fully engaged in pure devotional service.
It becomes completely spiritualized. And when he quits that body, then fully spiritual body,
in that fully spiritual body, which he develops instantaneously, he goes back to Godhead.
He does not take birth again in this world. So I'll stop here. Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
